greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Periodic with period 2: repeat [4,2].
comment: A simple "Fractal Jump Sequence" (FJS).  An FJS is a sequence of digits containing an infinite number of copies of itself. Modus operandi: underline the first digit "a" of such a sequence then jump over the next "a" digits and underline the digit "b" on which you land. Jump from there over the next "b" digits and underline the digit "c" on which you land. Etc. The "abc...n..." succession of underlined digits is the sequence itself.
Simple continued fraction of 2+sqrt(6). - _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 21 2011
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,1).
formula: a(n) = 3 + (-1)^n = 4 - 2*(n mod 2) = 2 * 2^((n+1) mod 2). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 14 2014
xref: First differences of A007310. - _Fred Daniel Kline_, Aug 17 2020
